# Commanding Officer This guidebook entry is all about the rules and laws of a Commanding officer, each listed in these sections:
The [textlink="Captains Authority" link="CapsAuthority"] is about the Commanding Officers (Or Captains) ultimate authority on station. Along with definitions on what that authority means. [bold]Do note that a legally appointed captain has extra rights![/bold]
The [bold]Commanding Officer[/bold], is an officer appointed to lead the station and its Command department, following the [textlink="Line Of Succession" link="LineOfSuccession"]. The [bold]Line Of Succession[/bold] states all of a Commanding Officers duties and guidelines for if a Commanding Officer is not/no longer on station.
The [textlink="Command Promotions" link="CommandPromotions"] is information on how a Commanding Officer can authorise crew members into Command positions if the vacancy of a position is a detriment to the crew.
Next, [textlink="Mutiny" link="Mutiny"] is if a situation arises where the current Commanding Officer is unfit for duty. This section describes what to do if this happens.
And finally, [textlink="Foreign Vessels" link="ForeignVessels"] is guidelines on what to do if an unknown ship approaches the station.
